rule_name: Suspicious Login from TOR Exit Node
raw_log: Failed login attempt for user trading_admin@swift.com from TOR exit node 185.220.100.240. Multiple failed attempts detected from anonymized network.
Service account payment_processor@swift.com gained administrative privileges outside normal workflow. Privilege escalation detected during non-business hours.
User back_office@swift.com accessed wire transfer database outside normal business hours. Data volume: 150% above baseline, unusual query patterns detected.
Malware signature detected on trading system host trading-prod-001. Process: suspicious_trader.exe. Immediate isolation required.
Suspicious network activity detected. Host 10.0.3.45 attempting connections to multiple internal systems. Pattern matches known lateral movement techniques.
Large volume data transfer detected from financial database to external IP. Volume: 2.3GB, Destination: suspicious external host. Financial records potentially compromised.
Trading system access outside authorized hours. User trader_john@swift.com accessed market data systems at 19:45 (after market close). Potential insider trading concern.
Cryptocurrency mining software detected on workstation. High CPU usage and network connections to mining pool. Resource abuse on company infrastructure.
Unauthorized database schema modification detected in financial_transactions table. Admin database_admin@swift.com modified critical financial data structures without proper approval.
Suspected command and control communication detected. Encrypted traffic to known APT infrastructure. Pattern matches Lazarus Group communication protocols used in previous financial sector attacks.
